Reviews.Title: “A bit tired roomdesign but wow what a feeling :-)”
Reviews.Author: CamillaLejon
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in far more luxurious hotelrooms in for instance China. But what the hotels in China lack and Kempinski Bristol don't is old time charm and a classy feeling. The service is superb and very friendly. The concierge was extremely helpful. So be prepared that even the superiour rooms are quite small and the design is a bit dated BUT they are lovely. The beds and pillows are very comfortable, plenty of hot water in the shower and double glazed windows. The location is as perfect as it could be. A 10-15 min walk to KaDeWe and 3 minutes to Hard Rock Café. The local bus from Tegel Airport stops right outside the hotel and costs 2,30 EUR. If you think the breakfast a bit to expensive, a bug Starbucks is right opposite the hotel as well. The swimmingpool is very beautiful and the special lift to the SPA area is perfect. If you would like a romantic place to stay in Berlin during a weekend, I highly recommend this hotel. We got a fantastic deal via the Scandinavian Airlines Website, 190 EUR for 3 (!) nights exkl. breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lidia M
Reviews.Content: The only "problem" of this hotel is that you have to pay for WiFi, and normally hotels that cost this much offer free WiFi to their guests. But in general the rooms were small but nice, the bathroom was huge and VERY clean. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Business center is located on the ground floor if you need to use the internet. Breakfast will satisfy all of your hearts desires. There are always taxis waiting outside. The Hard Rock cafe is just around the corner and you can walk to KDV shopping center and check all the great stores on the way there. The bar offers very tasty drinks, but not such a great variety of them.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Yes !”
Reviews.Author: mic_Limhamn_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Old Kempinski Bristol (Original site for Kempinski's) is still going strong, And they have the most fantastic pillows I have ever been in contact with during my over 3000 hotel nights

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, as expected from a hotel of this standard”
Reviews.Author: apfelwein
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for a business trip in October and spent two nights at the Kempinski. The hotel is located just off the Kudamm, it is very convenient for shopping and eating out. A taxi ride to/from the airport is just under 20 EUR. The rooms were fine, a good size, comfortable, clean and with all the amenities you would expect in a five star hotel. The breakfast buffet was also fine and the bar staff were friendly and helpful. The front desk was friendly but the check-in and check-out process were a little slow. All in all a good stay, everything was as it should be in such a hotel. 1 star less for the slow front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Going back!”
Reviews.Author: sandy24Ireland
Reviews.Content: oo this hotel was lovely! i didnt know what to expect as it was getting mixed reviews! we stayed in room 427 and it was lovely fancy bathrobes, slippers, and amazing bath! Very easy to find and a 5 minute walk from teh zoo train station! we didnt eat in the hotel but finished off evey night with a cocktail or two ! cafes are all around the area we found a lovely 24 hour place breaky was 5 euro each, and you could have anything! its called Schwarze Cafe, ask the Concierege adn he will direct you! 5 mins walk literally!has everything from breakfast, to salads, coffee, homemade cakes paninis etc!! Staff were amazing and reccomended to us 2 restaurants to try and they were lovely, deffo try the "Wintergarten" 3 minute walk from hotel and easy to find! Sauna and facilities were lovely even though it has no clothes you are able to put towels around you a lot of pple seemed to think you had to go naked but you could if you wanted but towels are allowed! Over all no faults and will be back, they even made us hand made easter cards with a little plate of different chocolate eggs in our room for easter, lovely personal touch! Mrs Whelan

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay at the right price”
Reviews.Author: AngelaScott
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here, got a good room rate. Just a shame pool was closed while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Kempinski Hotel Bristol”
Reviews.Author: cahz Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent from the minute we arrived. Check in was quick and was offered to come babk and choose another room if we were unhappy with the room. Turn back service was efficient and when asked for ice it appeared within 2-3 minutes. Room was spacious we had a junior suite , Location was excellent U Bann station just on corner and the airport bus within 200 meters. Excellent shopping on the door step. We enjoyed the breakfast which had a good choice of food only thing i could fault was only offered a choice of cooked items not on the buffet once. The food in the restaurant at night was excellent a well. We had a fantastic and was unwilling to leave

Reviews.Title: “A perfect short term stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: matt_evans75
Reviews.Content: The Kempinski is a lovely hotel located perfectly for tourists. Although a bit tired in places the Hotel is modern and offers all of the amenities that you need for a city break. The Concierge was exceptionally helpful, as were all of the staff, the rooms were reasonably well appointed, although the friends we stayed with had a somewhat smaller room than ours. The breakfast was a good quality continental and hot food self service. The amenities in the Health Spa were lovely. A good sized pool, sauna and steam room and a juice bar, perfect for unwinding after a day site seeing. The only negative was the cost of the bar. Unless your drinking the local beer at 5 Euros, the rest of the drinks were on the expensive side. All in all an excellent place to stay t enjoy this most surprising and delightful city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shal22
Reviews.Content: We found all the staff to be very helpful and friendly and the service was good. The only thing that we found strange is having to remove your swimming clothes to go into the sauna/shower area. Why would you want to remove your clothes in front of complete strangers!!!

Reviews.Title: “old world Berlin”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: Picked the Bristol because we had stayed there years ago. The location continues to be great -the Ku'damm is still very central to everything and we could take the Ubahn everywhere farther out. Room was very old style with a small separate hallway and furniture from about the 1950s (including, oddly,2 statues locked behind glass vitrines.) Great old marble bathroom with 2 sinks and bidet and robes and a super shower head. We left the windows open for air conditioning. The lobby and bar rooms are impressive: old style Berlin and the staff was wonderful, helpful and respectful which you seldom find in hotels today. Had the small breakfast in the Gobelin hall which was €15 and included juice, coffee, rolls, croissants, breakfast meats, cheese and fruit- more than sufficient. Great to have a coffee or drink at the restaurant on the corner of the Ku'damm and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but only Good!”
Reviews.Author: EmJo22
Reviews.Content: On the entrace to this hotel you deffinatley get the wow factor. Me and my partner spent 5nights here in March 2012, on our arrival they had totally mixed up our details different address and title, seemed very odd but not too much of a problem but just not expected of a 5* hotel. Our room was lovely and spacious with an extremely lovely bathroom. The hotel guide book was helpful but had a lot of general things missing like restaurant and pool opening times, how to pay/order from the mini bar etc. No tea or Coffee facilities in the room which was a big let down. Drinks and food in the Bar extremely over priced would reccomend taking a walk down the road as theres a few nice restaurants around.The curtains in the room (All 3 of them on one window) did not meet in the middle or where too thin, a lot of light seeps through. However the beds where comfy and the pool was excellent. very quiet hotel apart from the bars as theres a lot of business people around. We are from around Hull and deffinatley not posh so dont be put off by the 5* and thinking you wouldnt look right, you are made to feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “great location very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Kempinski Hotel. The room was fine and the breakfast which was included in the price was excellent. The bar prices were higher than in England but look at the location. I felt overall it was very good for what we paid. The staff were all very good and we left our bags so we could enjoy our last day as we had a late flight. The station is 10 mins walk away and handy for the airport. I hope to return in the future had a great time, Berlin is fantastic and I would stay again at the Kempinski. We were offered an upgrade to one of the refurbished rooms when we arrived for an additional 30 E per night but we were fine after looking at the room we had booked and stayed put, spending the money on other things, and there are plenty of things to buy in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fco
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights as part of a BA package to Berlin and hence a good rate including breakfast. We had an unrefurbished double room, which was quite small as was the bathroom. However, fine for 3 nights and had all the usual accessories. The room was dated rather than tired. The room tended to be hot (triple glazed) and no heating controls other than valve on the radiator, which could be turned off. If window was left open then too much early morning (0500) noise from garbage collection etc. The hotel wanted Euro50 extra per night for a refurbished/upgraded room. Breakfast was plentiful but would be expensive at E25 pp if not included in room rate. Front desk staff and concierge excellent although breakfast staff a bit unsmiling, the lady Maitre d' audibly "huffed" when we asked to refill the milk! Never did hear the doorman say welcome etc at any time, even when arriving with bags. Easy access to hotel by 109 bus from Tegal, simple 200m walk. Well placed for buses and trains from Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kiki4321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights whilst visiting Berlin. The room was a rather small double room with not much space for luggage which mean stumbling over bags to get to the bathroom in the night. The bathroom had a drain in the middle of the floor which appeared to be filled with water almost to the top, it was smelly and didn't ever seem to drain - tho it never overflowed either. The hotel has a pool on the lower ground floor which was a welcome thing as the day we arrived it was 33 degrees! Overall it was an ok place to stay and we got a good deal on the price, so I guess we got what we paid for.. If you're after a luxurious 5 star hotel, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great facade; not so great heart.”
Reviews.Author: angela143
Reviews.Content: The kempinski is a stunning hotel. The exterior gives a great first impression and the reception area is simply stunning. The staff are so polite and helpful and the bar areas are second to none. There is a fantastic spa area where you are well looked after, although beware that you are expected to enter the sauna naked!! Now for the negatives; we paid extra for a superior room and was a little disappointed. The room was very small, the decor was dated and the carpet a little threadbare not what I would have expected from a superior room in a five star hotel! On the whole a great hotel in a good location but a little overpriced for the rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Englishman101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in Feb 2012. Had one of the newly refurbished Junior Suites which was superb. Bathroom was great with a separate shower area and massive overhead drench shower - I could have been in there for hours! Yes it is a pricey hotel - but the service is fabulous - staff were the perfect mix of highly professional but very friendly. Sometimes you go to a 5* where they can be a bit snooty - certainly not here! Breakfast was included in our deal and was very good. Lovely fresh juices, fruit, cold meats and yogurt. You could also have scrambled eggs and bacon - and if you really want they will cook whatever you want as well. We went in the pool and there is a small bar area where you can offer coffee and fresh fruit smoothies. Did not try the sauna (no clothes allowed in there) but maybe next time. Would definately go back - though we also want to try the Kempinski Adlon in Berln too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: A great location on Ku'Dam amongst the posh shops and an easy bus ride to most major attractions. Buses M29, 200 and 100 got me most places, and the T and S (subway) also close. Zoo station a 5 min walk away, to connect to airport trains and buses

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of the old Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel and very luxurious and for the price i paid in November an absolute steal.try the Afternoon tea with apple strudel,to die for!You could be in 30s Berlin as you sip your tea and look around at the opulent surroundings. this hotel would be lost on the younger party crowd.it is far too mature an area anyway for that sort of clientele,this hotel is perfect for business and older couples.the piano bar is lovely,the rooms themselves are pleasant but quite small,well the one we got was! the pool is small but just right for a splash about,the sauna and steam as per usual on the continent is nude only so if you are squeamish.....grow up! lots of naked bodies of all ages will pass your eyes so just get used to it,you are in Germany! the little welcoming mints and free tea/coffee should not be overlooked as they were very welcome and the snuggly bathrobes and the lift to the pool in them is a treat,a great hotel for chilling out and really doing nothing but relaxing. will see you soon Kempinski!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not quite 5*”
Reviews.Author: lola s
Reviews.Content: Really good location, relatively large rooms. Got a great deal from Lastminute.com for half price on a 4 nights stay, I don't think it would have been worth the full fare, but it was a good bargain. Service was somewhat lackluster, and the breakfast options weren't great. The pool /spa area was quite small for such a large hotel and the spa treatments on offer were a bit expensive. The rooms are well maintained for an old building, and the beds are clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - good service”
Reviews.Author: lefisk
Reviews.Content: Location: Top, Service: Top. Good price. Good breakfast. Close to Ka De We and shopping. Close to good German ordinery restaurants. (Eisbein, snitzel, beer and Maltheserkreuz.) Sauna and swimmingpool.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and relaxing place.”
Reviews.Author: Viajero-Alfa
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin on January 14th, early in the morning, we took a bus that left us two blocks away from the hotel and we got a room at the Bristol-Kempinski without any problem. We stayed there till the 17th when we left to Italy. Our room still had the old bulky tv sets (while other rooms have flat screens), the wi-fi is expensive and one needs only to cross the street to get it free a the corner cafe however, for a five star hotel, the deal was excellent. The hotel staff was very helpful, answering questions to my wife, and the man at the spa was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ro_FoCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 28 Dec until 1 Jan, and found the Hotel to be very nice. We were given a lovely room on the fourth floor, with a large bathroom complete with fluffy robes. The staff were also very friendly and attentive. Although this hotel is a 5 star, I did feel that it was a little dated in parts and not up to the usual 5 star standard that I would have enjoyed from other 5 star hotels. In any event, we got a good rate for the four nights, so I can't really complain. It is also located on the KuDamm, which is the main shopping street in Berlin, and a hive of activity around Christmas time, especially with the markets. We ordered room service a couple of nights and the food was ok (not the best to be honest, as the food was cold), especially considering a Burger and Chips is the bones of Euro 20 with service charge. We also availed of the Hotel's pool area in the basement which is lovely. A nice bright room with loungers and a cocktail bar. People were lying around the pool relaxing, reading their newspapers and having a few drinks. We were in the pool talking (at a normal level) and the Bar Man came over to inform us that we were to stop talking as the room was a "relaxation room". To be honest, I was very angry at this statement - People were asleep around the pool and we couldn't chat. If people want to sleep - they should go to their rooms! In any event, we decided to leave the pool and go into the Sauna/Steam Room for a small while. The sign outside read "strictly no swimwear to be worn in steam room", to which we quicly retired to our bedroom to freshen up. All in all, good hotel, good location, ok-ish food....worth it if you can get it for a good rate. i wouldn't pay top dollar for this hotel in any instance.

Reviews.Title: “5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: Larr91
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend (we are 23 and 21) spent the first weekend in January at this hotel, we booked through lastminute.com where we got a very good deal for a 5 star hotel. The hotel is located in the Kurfurstendamm area of Berlin which is full of shops, restaurants etc and very easy to get to using the train services. From Schonefeld airport we found it easy to get the train directly to and from the Zoo train station which is a very simple 5 minute walk from the hotel. We checked in at around 11pm and did not even need to introduced ourselves as the reception staff already knew who we were! Check in was very easy and staff advised us on how to get around Berlin and what sights to see, they also gave us a map/guide of Berlin which was very useful! Room was lovely, 2 single beds joined together but very comfortable, tv with international channels, a minibar which at first seemed expensive but drinks are actually the same price as they are in the hotel bar and many other local bars. Bathroom is lovely, very clean. Only went to the pool and spa area once, be warned no clothes are allowed in the sauna! Pool is lovely very relaxing and quiet. Check out (12noon) was also very easy and the reception asked if we would need to leave our bags in the luggage room until we were ready to collect them later that day to travel to the airport. We were given a card to attach to our luggage and one to hand in later to exchange for them. Overall loved the hotel and it's location, very deserving of it's 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Paraiso en Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dise��adora
Reviews.Content: Realmente fue un oasis encontrarnos este hotel en Berlin. Las instalaciones son bellisimas, los cuartos maravillosas con camas ortopedicas, maravilloso despues de andar brincando de tren en tren en europa. Junto al hotel hay un starbucks que nos cayo de maravilla. Esta muy bien ubicado, lleno de restaurantes alrededor. El servicio inmejorable, un dia me lastime un pie y me acondicionaron el cuarto para que yo descansara como una reina. Lo recomiendo como uno de los mejores lugares para hospedarse en esta ciudad.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: ryanj31
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to staying in Berlin, but this hotel front desk staff was just the worst. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. So dropped off our bags and set out for a day of sightseeing. We didn't arrive back to the hotel until around 8 p.m. When we attempted to check in, front desk personnel told us that we should be very happy because we had been "upgraded." My girlfriend and I were both excited, until we saw the room. It was the side-room (or "parlor" room) for a suite! It was literally the smallest room I've ever stayed in while traveling internationally. The bed, which was not quite a double, pulled out from the wall. When I called and asked about our supposed "upgrade" the front desk staff rudely told me that this room was the only one available in the hotel. I insisted that this room was not up to par for what I had paid, but they flatly told me nothing else was available. No apology. So basically, since we weren't there and since the hotel was obviously overbooked, they put us in a throw-away room. Not cool. The lobby was very nice, but we will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh but not intimidating”
Reviews.Author: Alycat
Reviews.Content: .Stayed here on good deal through lastminute.com. Transfer from Schönefeld airport straight forward. 3Euros into Zoo Gdns then 5min walk down main road so felt safe. It is not very clear but when you buy a ticket for the transport in Berlin you have to then VALIDATE it or you can be fined. Machines can be found easily on the train platforms once you know they are there but they are not glaringly obvious if you do not look for them. There is an underground station virtually outside but by the time you have changed trains it is quicker to walk. Impressive from the outside with lots of lights (was Christmas time) and red carpet up the stairs and old fashioned dressed doorman and luggage boys (although the ones we saw were girls). Lovely Christmas tree in the lobby. Check-in efficient and heard the staff speaking several languages, they were certainly fine with English. They also were helpful in assisting us with a choice of markets and travel advice. Recommend the Welcome Berlin card as this allows 2 or 3 day travel on any form of public transport plus reductions in several museums (and they were ones you might actually want to visit such as the Jewish museum and the DDR museum), just don't forget to validate your ticket ! Room pleasant and we felt large.I think it was in the old side but didn't see a new side so not sure. Bed very comfortable but 2x single duvets which was different- stopped the husband hogging though so might think about it at home!! We didnt have a suite but there was a hall way of sorts with separate door to bathroom and bedroom. Old style TV with vast choice of channels for all languages. Only news and sport in English but as we were there for culture and the Christmas markets it was not a problem. Bathroom clean and serviceable with toiletries. Usual weak hairdryer situated i the bathroom.Towels thin and definitely not fluffy but this suits me. Bathrobes had also not been washed with fabric conditioner but were a nice touch. Only complaint was that the walls were thin and we were woken on 2 mornings by our neighbour's alarm/phone vibrating on the table and then him running a bath. Didn't think this was right for 5* hotel hence only 4 stars. Our deal did not include breakfast but you could have an American b'fast for 25Euro each or continental for 16 each. We did not bother but if you want anything other than McDonald's b'fast or coffee with bread variety you may struggle finding something in the immediate vicinity. We went for a swim in the hotel pool which is relaxing. Towels and robes provided as is locker key. Pool area clean with loungers and refreshment area. Sauna is mixed but beware it is naked. There is a dry and wet sauna with showers and cold plunge area. There are no showers in the changing rooms (which are single sex) which would have been useful. The first bar was quite open and we felt lacked atmosphere but the second bar further down the corridor was more intimate and allowed for a relaxing drink and chill out after foot pounding various markets. Area around the hotel is quite upmarket with other guests arriving in chauffeur driven Mercs/BMWs with fur (and I think they were genuine) coats and designer clothes/shoes. We felt quite scruffy in jeans and jumpers with walking coats and boots but the hotel staff did not appear to mind. Would happily stay here again if got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Jesse1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at he Kempi, as it is referred to by old-time Berliners, for six days in November. We had a junior suite in the "old" part of the hotel. The room itself was very spacious with slightly dated but comfortable furniture. The walk-in closet off of the entryway is ideal for storing luggage and clothing and was a real plus in making the space feel less like a hotel room. The one thing that was really dated was the television, a boxy non-flat screen. The new part of the hotel has flatscreens (I asked). The bathroom had a tub hand-shower combo, which worked well. Just a word to anyone with physical disabilities: you have to be agile to get into the tub and it requires just as much balance to get out. We had a corner view onto the Kudamn which was a nice touch. The type and location of the room makes a huge difference at this hotel, as it is an older non-cookie cutter property. Some singles are tiny while others are spacious. Dining: We had breakfast at the hotel each of the days that we stayed there, as it was included in room rate. I suggest trying to get a rate with breakfast included, otherwise full breakfast is 25 Euros. We did not tire of the breakfast selection, as it was fresh, with an ample selection of fruits, cereals, cheeses, breads etc. Nice selection of juices, teas and coffee. Staff was very friendly and attentive. A solid A. Other dining: We ate dinner here twice and once had afternoon "kaffee und kuchen." Good selection but pricey, so look at the menu prior to make a reseravtion. Overall: Staff at front desk was spot on, conceirge was also very helpful, as were the bellmen. Pool is large by Berlin standards, also a touch dated but very relaxing to lounge by. Small shops in hotel are a nice touch and my mother used the hairdresser and was impressed by the professionalism and quality. Location really gets an A+. U-Bahn 10 meters outside hotel with elevator access and Bus stop 100 meters away. Cannot ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Kempinski Bristol, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Marina70_11
Reviews.Content: We found the service in this Hotel very good, lots of offers of help in the foyer with luggage, etc. Our rooms were large with 2 comfy armchairs, the bathrooms were also large, having a bidet in addition to the usual bath (with overhead shower), 2 washbasins. The sides of the bath are quite high and difficult to climb out of. We ate a good breakfast elsewhere (Krombach Gast House nearby) due to the cost of the hotel breakfast. We would definitely return to this hotel and to Berlin. Marina

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in the middle of Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Laweier
Reviews.Content: Well this time I stayed only for one night. The hotel is nice enough but I recommend the renovated part. You can find good prices for this hotel but only for the no renovated part Wich is still pretty fine and clean. Good service and good language skills for the staff. Can definitely go back. Breakfast 25€!

Reviews.Title: “Still Classy”
Reviews.Author: sambea
Reviews.Content: It used to be the best hotel in the best location - the tour buses even say so! The best location has moved east and there a fancier new hotels, but the Bristol is still a classy hotel in a good location. Service is as expected in a 5 star place. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, if not very big. One drawback: free internet is limited and slow, paid internet is expensive and not great. Best treat: Rienhard's Cafe is comfortable, good food, and not overpriced. If you can get a room under 120 Euro - take it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality traditional style”
Reviews.Author: pepe-1976-pepe
Reviews.Content: Hotel with long tradition, exceptional service and great location. Practically nothing to complain about. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: winkpc
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous negative views of this hotel, I have to say that I found no fault during the three days I stayed there in October. First of all, every staff member I had contact with was pleasant and accommodating. Secondly, I was given a very nice room for a prepaid rate of about $100 a night. I used the steam room and pool on all three days I was there and loved it. (There is only one set of elevators that go to that level. There are lockers, but bring along your robe from the room.) The hotel is in a good location and there are many good restaurants on the side streets nearby. I took the SBahn from the Central Train Station (Hauptbahnhof) to the Zoo station. The SBahn can be found on the top level of the Hbh. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. Just follow the SBahn track back in the direction you came from and then make a left on Fasanen Str. and the hotel is up the block.

Reviews.Title: “Very old rooms”
Reviews.Author: JMRif
Reviews.Content: Lobby of the hotel is very nice, however when you enter your room, you feel transported back to the early 90's. Furniture and choice of colors in rooms is old, televisions old ( not flat screens), bathrooms very old style. For the money, would stay in a more modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Fashioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craig0581
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much the old-style hotel, certainly not modern, very typical in Europe and well maintained. Food- very good. Had a really nice waitress who would bring us complimentary cookies just because she wanted to. Room- Very clean, small, comfortable bedding, I slept very well. Quiet too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this neighborhood before and really love it. As this is touted as a "luxury hotel, I would clearly have expected more overall. However, in general, the staff was quite friendly; room was clean (and there is nightly turndown service). But the hotel feels "old" not in an elegant way- and there was nothign particuarly special about it. Of course I did not avail msyelf of the pool or sauna etc and that could have swayed me...but I would easily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as it should be”
Reviews.Author: SalisburyMoonraker
Reviews.Content: The Bristol Kempinski is just what you expect from the place, possibly not the most luxurious in Berlin, but probably the most stylish. Its location on the Kurfurstendamm is ideal, there is still a vibrant atmosphere on the Ku'damm, if not as busy as in the days before the Wall came down. The hotel is elegant, the rooms very comfortable and ours was a good size. An unusual touch was having two lavatories, one in the very well appointed bathroom, and another separate one.. The staff were attentive, the breakfast was very good , the pool and spa area wonderful and not to be missed. The Bristol Bar is cosy and intimate if rather expensive with a Baileys or Asbach brandy at 8 euros each. The hotel's Cafe Reinhardt is a lovely place to sit out and watch the world go by. We'll definitely be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, beware AC description”
Reviews.Author: Farmboy20021
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay, staff all very attentive, and hotel very comfortable. Great location but a few words of warning. For our room AC meant "air cooling " not "air conditioning" - as it does in 99.9% of the world. This meant that even in October we had to sleep with no sheets or duvets as the room was so hot, and if you opened the window (3 inches max.) you got no cooling (as it automatically turned of the fan) but plenty of traffic and train noise in the morning, so you had no choice but to put up with a very noisy fan wafting warm air around the room. There was no tea or coffee making facilities, expensive wi-fi, and the hotel was not cheap - (house white - 9 euros for a glass (not large)). Small issues I grant but it is the small things that make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: tinycampbell
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, great location, attentive staff. however it was let down by a couple of things. firstly the room was very small, it was not possible to pass one another in the room, if you needed to one of us had to stand in the entrance to the room. secondly our bathroom was not the cleanest, i appreciate that other people had stayed there before us, however in a 5 star hotel i do not expect to see evidence of this, i can tell you the lady who stayed in there before us had long black hair.... i know this as it was all over the shower wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clamrj
Reviews.Content: The Kempinski Hotel Bristom in Berlin is a fairly predictable hotel in the heart of a vibrant, fashionable part of Berlin. The location is by far the best part of staying in this hotel. It is an inexpensive taxi ride from the airport, approximately 20 euros, and is within walking distance of the elevated train that will take you all over Berlin. The main avenue, Kurfurstendamm, has very nice shopping and several sidewalk cafes where it's fun to watch the people passing by. The hotel itself is typical of a beautiful old European hotel with clean, small rooms and stuffy staff. The breakfast is good but overpriced, there are better options on Kurfurstendamm. The rooms are clean but small and the air conditioning in the rooms does not work well. If your room faces construction across the street and you open your window be aware that construction starts very early in the morning. On future trips I will look for better options.

Reviews.Title: “location is the best bit”
Reviews.Author: Tattooed-oik
Reviews.Content: wasn't impressed to be honest, and i only usually want a bed in a clean room when i go away. very grand hotel, didn't use any of the facilities at all as so much to see and do in Berlin - found the staff a bit sniffy - i doubt their usual clientele is "the tattooed oik" in his hoodie and combats but i'm still a paying guest!!! bed was comfy, room was clean although not as grand as front of house and i'm not pointing fingers unnecessarily but this was the only place i used a credit card (as the room deposit) that got cloned!!! sours my view of this place - on the upside the hotel is in a very nice location, cracking bierkellar / restaurant up the road a bit and lots of transport links and high end shopping just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “weekender”
Reviews.Author: Weekender16092011
Reviews.Content: First time to Berlin taxi was unable to find the hotel i eventually spotted the hote after the taxi stopped the clock. The hotel was very nice good rooms and a great location, shops near by the Hop 0nbus just across the road and avery nice French restaurant nearby called Belmondo near the hotel check with the concierge. We really Berlin lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A nice coming back three years later”
Reviews.Author: Simplyred87
Reviews.Content: It was a nice sentimental coming back three years after the first time for few days starting on Septemebr 12th; room at the old part of Hotel was renovated at a modern high standard level. All Hotel parts - reception, lobby, bar, restaurants, shops etc.create an ecellent tastly mixture of modern & classic styles so nothing has been disappeared and lost from old times as you can observe at many hotel renovations all over Europe where such works are made at a very primitive way without taste and proportion. Service at all sectors - lobby, reception, room, breakfest - are excellent therefore you can feel comfortably during a whole stay & time since Mrs.Birgitt Ullerich, GM cares about visitors being deeply engaged at daily supervision of her staff and Hotel operation. The opinion about a delight restaurant and food of Hotel restaurant GRILL is exposed at another part of TripAdvisor part Restaurant .To recapitualte we're dreaming to come back in order to spend another time at KEMPINSKI BRISTOL soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: urangambler
Reviews.Content: First time trip for three nights to Berlin for my girlfriends birthday. The Kempinski is a gorgeous hotel, very plush and the hotel staff couldn't be more friendly. The concierge staff were very knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room was big and comfy and the bed and pillows were divine. The location is super, handy for three train stations and right across the road is a bus stop for the open bus tour. We dined in the Kempinski restaurant on our last night and the food and service was magnificent, can't rate the whole experience highly enough and I would definitely go back both to this hotel and to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to Kempinski Bristol Hotel and I hope it was not last one. I felt in love with this hotel at first sight. Yes, maybe it isn't so modern, but rooms are very nice and comfortable. Service at hotel is really great!!! Swimming pool is a big plus. Breakfast is very delicious. Location of the hotel is perfect, Ku'damm is my favorite place in Berlin. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back any time”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers088
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Kempinski Bristol Hotel. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, all staff friendly and helpful. Excellent service. It is in one of the best locations of the city with good transport from Kurfuerstendamm to all places of interest. Alternatives to the buffet breakfast are offered in the 'Kaffeehaus' with 'a la carte' breakfast choices, small cafes nearby offer a reasonable breakfast and the 6th floor of the department store 'Karstadt' became our favourite start of each day. There is a direct bus connection from the stop near the hotel to airport Tegel at minimal cost. We had a splendid week in Berlin, with plenty to see and do, which did not deplete the bank account, and we will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Old smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Simian03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend in Berlin. Our experience started positively as the foyer was nice. After getting to the room we realised we had been duped as they do have modern rooms but we certainly weren't provided one. It smelt very musty and stale, we complained and a lady arrived and poured strong bleach in all the plug holes - this made the room smell even worse. We changed rooms to another shabbily decorated stale room. This room had no air conditioning and was very hot! We complained again to be told if we paid more money we would get an air con room! This not a good hotel as they refused to upgrade despite having air con rooms free!

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected...!!! - no pool and a smelly room”
Reviews.Author: OleJust
Reviews.Content: Spending the last 5 days in Berlin at Kempinski leaves me with a mixed feeling about the hotel...! I booked this hotel mainly due to the location and the pool as we had our 2 years old son with us. The location is fine, - however the pool and wellness area was closed for renovation. No information was given, at the time of booking, no information was given at the time of check in, and there were no information in the room about the closure. So it was a little hard for me to explain it to my son when we stood in our "speedos" infront of a closed pool. It was really poor service from the hotels side, and I was really surprised over the lack of information. I travel alot around the world with my job, and I have never been mis-informed in that way in even a 3 star hotel. When I asked in the reception about the lack of information, the guy at the desk just started looking at the internet and tried to see if there were any information on the webside, - which is still today not the case!!! then he called the sales dept. to find out why it was not there. Then he claimed that it was on my booking confirmation, which again was not the case. Only after this bla bla bla... he offered us to go to the pool at another hotel, 15 min. away. Well, it was an fine offer but just not what you are after with a small child, and absolutely not what I had booked and expected. The room - a superiour - was of a good size, but the smell in the bathroom was unbelievable. It smelled like there was a direct connection to the sewer, and only after complaining 2 days in a row, they managed to do anything about it. So the smell changed from sewer to an Over dose of mouth wash. The Breakfast buffet at the price of 25 Euro was OK, but not more than that, compared to the service and food offerings you can get at other 4 and 5 stars hotels arond the world. And 25 Euro is absolutely in the high end. So in conclusion - will I go back to Kempinski in Berlin? Most likely not Its a good hotel, but with the lack of information, the smell in the rooms and the price level, it must be possible to find a better hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDDots
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and rooms. The staff was fluent in several languages and very helpful. They had good tour recommendations and know the area. Breakfast was good but over priced and serivce was slow. Opt for a near by cafe. Starbucks is on the corner! Public transportation is across the street. and the shopping is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Yvolow
Reviews.Content: We were six friends who stayed at this hotel when visiting a wedding in Berlin, Midsummer 2011. When we arrived we were upgraded to suites on top floor which were fantastic. The service was so much high class and the poolarea so relaxing. They have a nice steamsauna with eucaluptus. And the best of all ... the breakfastbuffé with their own Kempinskichampagne. We will definitly come back to this hotel, and can´t even think of a nother one in Berlin. There were only one think we had in minds and that it was no free internet in such luxury hotel. Strange. Otherwise all was perfect. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “an enjoyable week”
Reviews.Author: Pyrkan
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, very central and convenient location for bus and underground transport. Good breakfasts, clean and comfortable rooms. Friendly and helpful staff, would stay there again when visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but the a/c could be a lot better!”
Reviews.Author: RobfromKensington
Reviews.Content: We (couple and adult daughter) arrived at 7 pm with an Expedia reservation and were very pleased to be upgraded to two superior rooms - overlooking the quiet side-street over the main entrance rather than looking over the spacious courtyard. We liked our rooms which were extremely quiet and well sized (despite what other reviewers might say) and our only real criticism is that the a/c in both rooms was feeble and either off or on - with no proper temperature control despite outside temperatures of 30 degrees C (well into the upper 80's F)! We had some rather restless nights as a consequence. The bathtubs in both rooms had very high sides and needed to to entered and exited with care. We did eat breakfast in the hotel one day - but for just 58 euros for the three of us (and a fourth duaghter - living elsewhere in Berlin). We did have to get the original incorrect 'buffet breakfast' charge reversed on departure - but 58 euros was for a truely enormous meal for 4 - and a very full doggy bag of sausage products taken away by our Berlin based daughter! We also found that there had been another error in the accounting system on departure (an incorreect posting) but that was quickly resolved and we left feeling very happy with our stay which cost us about £100 /$150 per room per night (excluding b'fast and extras). Good value, we thought. All the staff we met in the main hotel were very pleasant indeed and very professional, although some of the restaurant staff staff were perhaps not quite so professional.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal & not value for money”
Reviews.Author: MAT900XLT
Reviews.Content: Well situated Hotel on main Berlin shopping street, room excellent, some staff especially in the lounge bar seem to have eyesight difficulties, firstly being unable to see that he has customers, and then charging them different prices on different nights for the same order! This hotel is overpriced and needs a staff makeover, leisure facilities were extremely poor and should be removed from the wed sight. My wife found the attitude of staff (excluding reception) just rude. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “too much money, not enough value”
Reviews.Author: arimbaud64
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, well located, reasonable service, but small small rooms, even with an upgrade to "superior"; breakfast is not included, which is remarkable at this price. Internet service is not included, which is outrageous. Fitness center is a joke, it's a closet with two machines. there must be other places in Berlin that are a better value for what one pays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Gillian017
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kempinski the first week in May this year. The hotel is fantastic, the rooms very comfortable and service is first grade. The spa and pool facility are great just what you need after a long day treking around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April. Check-in was flawless, then problems started: our room was small and untouched since the 90s, safe wasn't working and there was a large water puddle in the carpet. We asked them to take care of it as we went for a walk, but when we came back it was still there, and rotting. They changed our room, put us in a smoking room even though we had specifically asked for non-smoking, so they changed our room again, back to a small & old version, but at least it didn't stink! Small pool with screaming kids. Beware: extortionate wi-fi fees and they try to charge if you use it for your laptop & iphone. Great location and great breakfast (not included). One of those take it or leave it hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Atmo1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and always received excellent service. The reception stay are very attentive and ensure everything is perfect for your stay. The rooms are modern and very comfortable and the location has easy access to the metro and great shopping. My only problem with the hotel is that they charge for wi-fi access, so I drank quite a few coffees across the road at Starbucks where wi-fi is free!

Reviews.Title: “The best experience”
Reviews.Author: soniasmith0
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel - lovely rooms, great restaurants, pleasant and efficient staff . This hotel is great for a business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Rodolphe
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights for business in this very well managed hotel in a perfect location for business, shopping and dining, 15 minutes from Tegel airport by taxi or bus. GM Birgitt is a most caring host, Service is outstanding, my colleague asked the doorman to park his car, 15 minutes later a staff member brought him his cellphone he had forgotten in his car before he realized havng forgotten it. Wonderful breakfast buffet with great choice of breads and cereals. My room was not big but very well furnished with large working space. Many international TV channels. Fitness room could be bigger. Will be back Rolf, MB, Paris

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lydiaibbotson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very grand and relaxing. Pool facilities are excellent, rooms are very comfortable. Watch out for the breakfast, nobody told us the price and it was €25 per person!! It was delicious though. The beds are foam matresses... not for me, too hard, but some might like it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiHMS
Reviews.Content: A hotel that calls itself a 5-star hotel like Kempinski does should really choose their staff more carefully. I have never been treated with such arrogance and bad attitude as what happened at this hotel. I travel a lot and have experienced both good and bad service, but nothing as terrible as at the Kempinski. This is particularily true concerning the staff at reception, but also don't expect any smiles in the restaurant. It is a pity that a hotel that in its glory days has been one of the landmarks of Berlin has sunk to this level. No wonder they are no longer members of The Leading Hotles in the World- chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jade811
Reviews.Content: Very central, beautiful hotel in west side of Berlin, very close to the Zoo and great shopping. Only downsides were the too-small gym and the rather expensive minibar... Excellent conference facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Old-fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Kempinski Bristol is just off of Kurferstendamm - about 10 minutes walk from Bahnhof Berlin Zoo and about 15 Minutes walk to KdW (Kaufhaus des Westens). Several reasonable restaurants in the vicinity but still worth travelling further for more choice. The hotel itself is very old-fashioned - Has an excellent breakfast buffet; good service. Some of the equipment is rather old - I always have the telephone disabled for ouside calls afet once being billed for an overseas call that I did not make. Pool and Fitness area.

Reviews.Title: “ungerechte doppel buchung und trotzdem stornierung kosten fordern”
Reviews.Author: clausmjensen
Reviews.Content: The following story is true and took place at hotel Bristol Kempinski in Berlin Friday 3rd December, 2010. On the 29th November, 2010 the undersigned booked 3 hotel rooms through Metglobal for the weekend 3rd to 5th December, 2010. The 3 rooms were for my twin sister and her husband, my parents and the undersigned with wife – to celebrate our 50th birthday party in Bristol Kempinski Berlin, which was a long standing wish/dream for all of us. On the 2nd December my father was urgently taken to the hospital in Aarhus, Denmark for immediate surgery. After having checked the situation with the hospital and my father, the rest of us decided still to go to Berlin, as this was the wish from our father. Subsequently we cancelled ONE room repeat ONE room out of the 3 reserved rooms on the 2nd December in the evening through Metglobal through whom we had booked the rooms In order to avoid any unexpected last minute surprises, and to make sure everyone were informed properly, we furthermore sent a separate email to Metglobal and called the hotel to advise about the changes the very same evening. We were informed by the hotel that no cancellation was received from Metglobal, but in any case everything would be taken care of, i.e. the 2 rooms for us were fine, and the one room for my parents would be cancelled. After a 650 kilometre and 8 hour drive through heavy snow, we were all looking forward to a well deserved rest and comfort in a nice 5 star hotel. To put it mildly big was our shock to be informed on arrival, after having been given the preprinted check in formulars from the very same gentleman, who informed us the evening before that all ok, that now suddenly for some sort of reason Bristol Kempinski was fully booked and all 3 rooms had indeed been cancelled. A 50 minute phone conversation with Metglobal (in USA) didn’t bring any solutions whatsoever, apart from even more costs, this time telephone charges – after one hour Bristol Kempinski eventually gave us a proposal to get two rooms for an additional euro 260 per night, which would then go on top of our euro 450 cancellation fee, i.e. a total of euro 372,50 per room instead of the booked fee of euro 150 per night. Needless to say Friday late afternoon in Berlin on the 2nd Advent weekend no great chances to get a decent hotel room, so having stayed one night only in another hotel next to the rail track at own costs on top of the euro 450 cancellation fee, which we had already paid for not sleeping at Kempinski !! we packed our suitcases Saturday morning and drove back 650 kilometre on our 50th birthday, as the Kempinski experience didn’t leave much interest and mood to celebrate further in Berlin. Claus M Jensen Hamburg

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: iDaria
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kempinski for 3 nights. Would never recommend the hotel to anyone. It was the only thing that spoiled our stay at fantastic pre-Christmass Berlin. 1. It's not a 5-star!!! rooms are dull, furniture - crummy. nobody helped us (me & my mom) with 2 pieces of realy large luggage upon arrival, the guy from roomservice forgot about our order (we had to order tea - as there're no tea/coffee facilities at the rooms)/ 2. chose Kempinski because of the pool & sauna only (otherwise I'd rather live as Radisson which is located 200 m form Kempinsky & is FANTASTIC, we stayed there in 2009) - but we couldn't use it as there was only 1 sauna - for both men & women and you're supposed to be naked while wisiting it! what a noncence!!! I just couldn't force myself to enter the sauna packed with naked men! 3. the hotel has a perfect location (but it's not the only one at Kudamm!) & breakfast was nice. 4. couldn't sleep in the mornings - poor soundproofing

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff, slightly faded glory”
Reviews.Author: Mighty-Red
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with a friend. Staff were exceptionally helpful and pleasant. My room was excellent but my friend opened her door to find that the room had not been made up - the staff were horrified and immediately took her to another room with a complementary fruit basket. The hotel still showed most of the sparkle of when it was the gem of the West Berlin crown, with reception, staff, spa and location all superb. The only downsides were that the rooms were perhaps a little outdated and certainly were too hot - even with the windows open in December. As you would expect from a 5* the bar prices were steep, as was breakfast - but with a Starbucks and other alternatives nearby you could choose the level you wished for. I would certainly not hisitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice lounge, nice restaurants, room not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: lochte
Reviews.Content: We got a special price for 3 nights in a standard room. It was small with no coffee making abilities. Not a 5 star hotel room. The breakfast is great but expensive. Nice lounge bar. Nice service. Near the best shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Out-of-date 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: streken
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, the staff friendly and I slept well. But for the rest, it was highly average, at the best. The hotel badly needs renovation if it wants to keep its five star rating. We paid 60 euros/night for our room, an ok price (especially compared to their normal prices). The location on Ku'damm was a bit disappointing. Lots of closed shops, little charm, and far from the actuel city center (Mitte). The only reason to go back; the proximity of KaDeWe with its wonderful food department. But even then, I would search for another hotel, sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations required”
Reviews.Author: Journey_on_earth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2010. The location is perfect for those who want to enjoy West Berlin, where all the shopping centers and restaurants are. We had stayed twice in East Berlin, which is more for museums and historic places. We love Berlin. It's a great city. The hotel is very easy to reach with bus X9 from Tegel airport that stops almost right in front of the hotel. We had reserved a superior room with Expedia. We chose the superior room, based on the reviews saying that the standard rooms were rather small and basic. Upon arrival at the front desk, I gave my reservation number, clearly saying that it was for a superior - non smoking room. When we got to our room (609), we noticed right away the cigarette smell. We also saw an ashtray with matches on the desk. So we went back to the front desk asking for another room. When we got to the 2nd room (525), we immediately saw that it was much smaller and older. We went back to the front desk, telling them that they had made a mistake, giving us a standard room. They said that we were wrong but nevertheless gave us another room. We showed them a picture of a superior room, taken from their web site. They laughed and said "oh, you want a room like on the picture? If it's what you want, sure we can give one to you". When we got to the 3rd room (531), it was exactly the same as the 2nd room (small and old). We were steaming as we realized that they were playing with us. When we got back to the front desk, we said that we were sick and tired of being treated like stupid. We asked for the keys of the first room that they gave us. We would have cancelled right away but having reserved with a 3rd party (like Expedia), it was already paid in full and non refundable. The rooms badly need renovations. There were tapestry patches peeling off the wall (see picture), cobwebs hanging from the wall lamps and the TV dates from the Wall period. Needless to say that we can't recommend this hotel. It's definitely not a 5-star hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: SalisburyWelshgirl
Reviews.Content: A fantastic 5* hotel. In a great spot for some of the best shopping and the start of all the bus tours. Rooms were spacious and the bed was amazingly conmfortable. Reinhart's restaurant is a delight. The pool was a little colder than I'd like but it was large and never busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tablerockin
Reviews.Content: I don't believe I have ever stayed at a hotel with a better staff. My only complaints were the TVs are the old style, not a big deal for me since I probably spent less than 30 minutes watching it over 4 days. And the air conditioning was weak but not too bad. The location of the hotel is fanastic, great shopping and alot of nice places to eat. I don't think I will look to stay anywhere else but here when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: crys94
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel as soon as we arrived. We took a taxi to the hotel from the Tegel airport (which is about 20 EUR) and as soon as the taxi pulled up, the staff was there to greet us and took care of our luggage. Customer service was superb and every single staff member was very helpful and sweet. Our room was very clean. Standard-sized room with a large bathroom and bathtub. We were welcomed with a bottle of water and some fruits on our table. The location is excellent. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. About a 10-minute walk to the Kaiser-Wilhelm Memorial Church and Europa Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Agust76
Reviews.Content: I first have to say that the hotel is situated at the best possible location in the city, but it comes with a price, especially if you happen to travel to Berlin during one of the annual conventions as the room rates get steep as availability of rooms in the city goes down. The room type I lodged in was "Junior Suite" but in all honesty, there was nothing Suite about it. It was just like a normal hotel room at the Berlin scale except the bathroom had a large bath tub with bubbles. The breakfast was perhaps the highlight, but as the hotel was crowded it was hard to get the attention of the coffee attendant and thus I have to give this hotel, given its time in operation a neutral, at least I would not stay here again and choose a Bed and Breakfast over this five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: missdeeBrussels
Reviews.Content: It was only when we arrived in the room that we learned that the pool area was inaccessible because of 'works', which explained the exceptional promotional price. Disappointing, since I really love to have a sauna treatment after a long day of city visits. But that wasn't all that didn't work out : it was only on day 3 that we received some of the toiletry products (body milk, hair conditioner), as well as the bathroom slippers. When ordering room service, 1 plate simply didn't arrive. The concierges were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel on Ku'damm. Fantastic staff, location, service and rooms!!! I was though rather surprised that they still have the old 4:3 televisions. And there were a bathtub instead of showers but really a hotel to recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, once again”
Reviews.Author: Grani70
Reviews.Content: I really wonder why some people have wrote negative reviews of this hotel. This was the second time we stayed at Bristol Kempinski and it was even bettter than before. The rooms were very stylish and the service excellent. We have also tried Hotel Concord, which was great and a small hotel Louisa's place in Ku'damm. Kempinski never lets you down. In this side of Berlin, the Bristol is the best also because of its excellent location. We suggest you try the Adlon Kempinski, if you want to stay other side of Berlin. Next time we will return Bristol. Definately the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: carr6775
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kempinski Bristol for 4 days last weekend. I have to start by saying that I do not recognise the negative picture that some other reviews here suggest. For a start, the building is a grand hotel in the best sense of the term. The lobby, bars, restaurants and room were in my view all entirely consistent with the 5 star rating that the hotel boasts. Service was excellent, from check in to the pool staff. The only blip was the older waiter in Reinhardts who really ought to remember that he works in the hospitality and service industry. His attitude left a lot to be desired. We found the surrounding area to be well served by bars and restaurants and there is no shortage of shopping opportunities without straying too far from the Ku'damm. In particular, the Maranello one block away is a good choice for authentic, good value Italian food with attentive, welcoming service. Unfortunately, we also witnessed the other end of the spectrum at Capones on the Ku'damm. We sat for 40 minutes without having as much as our drinks order taken. Our waiter was a caricature, attempting flair and charm but not managing the most basic things such as taking a drinks order or asking if we wished to order dinner. That was before he had a stand up row with one of his colleagues..... All in all, a mess and one to avoid! So, back to the Kempinski Bristol - thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “5 star pretention, no star service”
Reviews.Author: sh380
Reviews.Content: Location: 15 minute walk from Zoo Garten station. From there you can take the U-Bahn to the center. The hotel is relatively far from the center where the major sites and attractions are. As a welcome, fruit was brought to the room which looked like leftovers from the buffet breakfast: one bruised apple and a dry orange , not edible. Rooms are sober and without basic amenities like tea or coffee making facilities. Bathtub and shower curtain not very clean. Amenities in bathroom: 1 toilet soap, a shower cap and a plastic bag. No toothbrush, comb or slippers. Asked if this is normal outfitting for a room and Kempinski confirmed this. So housekeeping didn't forget anything. Bed not too big but ok. Asked at reception – due too a longer than scheduled meeting in Berlin I wasn’t able to travel home and had to stay overnight – if I could have a toothbrush and had to nearly beg for it before I got one. Staff uncooperative and rude. Send a complaint by email to the GM of this around 240 rooms hotel. Received a standard reaction after 1 week from her secretary, which can be summed up as “whatever”. Went for a swim in the swimming pool in the basement. Pool a little bit dated but nice size. Sauna and steam bath not very clean. Gym the size of a broom closet with ditto outfit. Staff member there didn’t speak English and only a few words German. Which was inconvenient because I needed a towel and bathrobe after my swim. This is definitely not a 5 star hotel. Not many guests when I stayed there. Now I understand why. Best to avoid this place when travelling to Berlin which in itself is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, Over priced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HenryClegg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, the rooms were small but well apointed, rooms did get a little hot with the ac being unpredictable. During our stay I had requested assistance from the concierge on a number of occasions, they were absolutely brilliant and organised everything, I can't compliment them enough. The breakfast was a buffet which although was nice did not get anywhere near being worth over the £20 cost. The location of the hotel is excellent no more than ten minutes from the central bus station and Berlin Zoo, it is right in the heart of the Berlin shopping area with enough shops to rival Oxford St, although better quality shops!

Reviews.Title: “WE WOULD GO AGAIN FOR SURE”
Reviews.Author: steo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights may/2010, well the comments we have read about were not clear..But ...The location is great...the breakfast was fantastic...the one meal we had in the hotel was excellent too..The room was ok nothing special but surely clean, and the attitude of the staff was superb..So why not ???we will be back..recommended..

Reviews.Title: “great location on Kudam!”
Reviews.Author: kypros73
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Berlin and this hotel in years. Great location on the main Kudam. fashionable area of town. The hotel was very reasonable in price. Room was very comfortable and the service very nice. I noticed that the hallways near accommodations were a little tired and need repair or replaced. Dined at hotel's restaurant which has had a great reputation in Berlin for many years. Bar was enjoyable and loved the atmosphere. The crowd were was watching a top soccer match on huge screen.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant experience-superb service and food”
Reviews.Author: DavidAlves
Reviews.Content: Have just come back exceptionally pleased with our 3 night stay at a bargain price. The location-bang in the centre of the shopping district and 50 metres from the U-Bahn couldn`t be bettered. The service is ideal-how on earth did they all remember my name? Food is very good indeed.Although-on the face of it-the breakfast is expensive-there was an amazing choice and variety-all top quality and no need for lunch! Meals on the pavement outside in the open air watching the passing scene, are a lovely way to while away an hour or two. Drinks are expensive-but served in a beautiful ambience in front of a real log fire! Rooms are not huge-but nicely presented and spotlessly clean. The swimming pool/sauna suite is lovely and relaxing. after a hard day`s shopping/sightseeing. The style is far from contemporary-but I found it all absolutely charming, would recommend unreservedly and would definitely look no further should I return

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: seniledelinquent
Reviews.Content: I think this is a really lovely hotel, I found the style to be fairly oldfashioned, and the public areas as well as the room I stayed in were 1950s high style rather than 21st century minimalism. The service was good, and the hotel was a comfortable place to stay in the depths of a Berlin winter. The swimming pool and health club area were great and I found all the staff to be extremely helpful. On the downside, my room was small, but tolerably so, as I spent little time in it, the charges for internet connection were exhorbitant at 25 euro per day and although the breakfast buffet was spectacular, it was also spectacularly expensive. The hotel restaurants were also relatively expensive, but they were aslo extremely good, and certainly the cost was no higher than it would have been in London restaurants of similar quality. The Ku'damm also has many cafes and restaurants as alternatives for meals and there is a large suoermarket nearby to stock up on drinks and snacks as an alternative to the minibar. I really didnt like the fact that the hotel followed the German habit of using two single duvets on a doubl bed and the fact that the 'double bed was actually 2 singles pushed together - and not phusically joined so it could and did slide apart. Overall a comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegence”
Reviews.Author: amadeaus
Reviews.Content: Theis hotel is situated in what was the old centre of Berlin before the waoll came down, near the Zoo. It has an old world charm & elegance about it. The service is exellent. The dining room supurb as is their room service. I have syated there three times now with my partner, it's excellent for business, close to everything. If you want to impress your clients this is the place to do it. If you just want to experience Germany prior to WW2 then this is what it was like, I suppose. The rooms are elegent and quiet. All the business facilites you could want an excellent car hire service available.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could use a facelift; wonderful bar”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyAnywhere
Reviews.Content: I got a good price on a last-minute stay here, and was quite happy. The lobby and bar area were every bit of the five stars I expected, and the location is terrific; right in the heart of the Ku-damm shopping/dining areas and right by the U-Bahn for easy access throughout the city. The rooms (and hallways), however are a little tired. I had a great corner room overlooking the Ku-damm. As a heavy sleeper, I did not notice any noise, but if that is an issue for you, beware. The room was also very crowded with the usual German double-twin set-up and both a desk chair and easy chair taking up most of the available space. Mirrored entry hall and a large window kept it from being claustrophobic, though. And the towels and bedding were lush and up to five-star standards. The highlight of the hotel, however, may be the Bristol Bar (apparently quite famous). My colleagues and I spent a happy hour or two enjoying some exotic cocktails, including one that the bartender invented on the spot. The descriptions led to some skepticism, but the drinks "worked" as served. One further thing ... Try the Nu restaurant if you are in the area ... 5-6 short blocks away and worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: WMcKEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is a truly lovely hotel in the heart of Berlin - on Kurfurstendamm - so central for everything including bus tours, shops and restaurants. Whilst Euro exchange made it a bit expensive - around £4 for a cafe latte - the food was lovely, the service excellent and rooms a good standard. We got a competitve rate from Expedia on room only and chose respective options which suited us individually for breakfast - you could always go out as plenty around iro options. Dinner was either in more standard restaurant or more fancy one which required jacket for men - did not go there but looked lovely if very pricey. Leisure facilities perhaps needed an upgrade but v comfortable and again, service was v good. A lovely break at a reasonable rate. Plan to go back at some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service & Location All Around”
Reviews.Author: fxybrzln
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my father who I work with. Location: Right in the middle of Berlin and close to our office (actually walking distance) Staff: WOW! They spoke many different languages, were courteous beyond belief and super seeded their duties. After leaving, we realized we had forgotten one of our passports and they shipped it to us in France. Service: Just awesome! Great personal services all around. Accommodations: Plush bedding and pillows, older tv but perfect internet service throughout the entire hotel. Rooms only have heat since it is always chilly in Berlin. Very quiet if you're a light sleeper like me. If this place is within your budget, go for it! Oh, and their breakfast buffet is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for affordable price”
Reviews.Author: SaintPatricius
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with affordable prices yet good service. And the location is in the center of everything, you literally need no transportation to get around, whether you're are shopping or site-seeing trip

Reviews.Title: “living on past glories....”
Reviews.Author: El-Cordobes
Reviews.Content: location is excellent but the rooms are small, grubby, worn and pretty average all round... breakfast is fine really couldn't recommend the hotel as the rooms are very disappointing living on past glories

Reviews.Title: “Buisiness an Leisure in Berlin , May 2007”
Reviews.Author: furbysound
Reviews.Content: Topp hotel, excellent and luxurious... Tempur madrasses.......satin bedlinnen...... short to all the seeings in vest Berlin Best hotell ever

Reviews.Title: “Caution!”
Reviews.Author: Polarine
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in a recent stay at the Bristol. The weather was hot and the hotel markets itself as being air conditioned but it is not. It has an air cooling system which is useless in hot weather. The room could have been cleaner and clearly needed updating. The location of the hotel is teriffic. Finally, I booked through Leading Hotels of the World for which I was to get certain amenities. Upon check-in I was coldlly informed that the Bristol was no longer a member of LHW and that I would receive nothing. It appears that the hotel is still a member of LHW so this is baffling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel very well situated”
Reviews.Author: watty77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights so we could visit the German Christmas Markets Check in was effortless & the staff very welcoming. Very well placed near all the shops & right on the KU Dam Rooms were a little shaby & could have done with a lick of paint ~ very clean though. The pool & spa were wonderful & a nice retreat after lots of shopping ! The reception & bar area were really attractive & had a roaring log fire to sit by.. Breakfast was an experiance in it self ~ Picture windows over look the Ku Dam & you can watch the world go by while eating a delicious breakfast & drinking chilled Prosecco. Service was second to none . Would visit again Many thanks to all the great staff there xxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Exelent stay”
Reviews.Author: SilentDiver
Reviews.Content: Exelent hotel with lot of history in the walls. Right in the spot of the city. Nerby subway and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: smsUk
Reviews.Content: Although not next to the main sights in Berlin, the hotel is great for anyone who is going there for tourism. It is just off one of Berlin's main shopping streets and is right next to the metro station that will take you closer to the city sights. The hotel was also very convenient when getting to and from Tegel airport as the bus stop is just around the corner and costs just 2.10 Euros for a single ticket and only takes 25 minutes. The standard rooms are quite small and ours was dated. Although I think they are in the process of refurbishing them. The beds were comfortable but our so called double bed was actually two single beds put next to each other and two seperate single duvets!. The hotel's swimming pool is great and opens from 6.30am until 10pm. There is also a very small gym (dated equipment which comprised of a running machine, rowing machine, exercise bike, step machine and some weights) and a sauna and steam room. Be warned though that no swimming costumes can be worn when using the sauna/steam room. Although towels/towelling robes are allowed. Breakfast costs about 20 euros per person but we just had breakfast outside everyday and there are so many places around that serve great coffee and cakes (including a starbucks just across the road from the hotel) and it is nice to go and try somewhere different every day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: thebaths
Reviews.Content: After arriving very late, due to flight delays, we were greeted by friendly staff. Although I ordered a "standard" room we were shocked by the poor quality of it. It was very small with dated, worn furniture. We phoned to reception to ask to change room who were helpful and came up to show us a number of other rooms, one of which would cost an extra 50 euros a night! We did settle for another room without paying the extra but I still am surprised that I was in a 3 star room, within apparently 5 star hotel. Pool was closed for maintenance. Would have liked to have known that in advance as was deciding factor in choosing this hotel. Could have used another hotel's pool 10 min walk away. Breakfast was fantastic. A lovely room with friendly courteous staff. A great choice or fruit, cereals, seeds yoghurts as well as hot food. Boiled and scrambled eggs, "roasted" bacon, sausages, meatballs. There was also the continental options of cold meats, cheeses. A lovely choice was a champagne breakfast with smoked salmon and prawns! As we had such a short visit we used the "hop on/hop off" tourist buses which were ideal and informative. All stop opposite the hotel. Location of hotel was good. Perfect if it is shopping you want. Great transport links. We got the train from S/feld airport to Zoogarten at cost of 2.80 euros each. Ofcourse, as we are in Germany the trains were on time and clean! 10 min walk to hotel from station providing you have good directions and don't get lost in the rain at 2300 hrs!! We had a nice evening in the A Trane jazz club. Concierge booked us a table (which you need to do). Drinks in hotel expensive. Bought wine from Karstadt on K'damm and put in room fridge. Overall a great weekend away just let down by the standard of rooms. Having said that room was immaculately clean with lovely bathroom providing robes and slippers and usual toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no air conditioning, prentitious maitre d in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JosephL
Reviews.Content: Room had little, if any, air conditioning or circulation-way below what is typical European AC. (Same in the other two rooms occupied by our group) Good thing the window opened, otherwise would not been bearable. Management said one of their two air compressors was not working. Strongly suggest you verify that this has been corrected before visiting. Maitre d in main restaurant would not seat us for dessert at 10:00 pm, claiming the hundreds of open tables were for dinner only. Ridiculous. No towels in the room when we checked in-had to call three times before someone brought them. Pool was closed for service. On the plus side-great location for shopping and accessing tours, restaurants. Starbucks across the street if you don't want the 25 Euro breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: Caerketton1
